free: #e There was a child.
#c 有一個小孩子。
#e And then that child took a frog.
#c 然後他拿了一隻青蛙。
#e And then he liked to play that (frog).
#c 然後他很喜歡玩那隻(青蛙)。
#n sia-vava 引伸出觀賞或把玩的意思
#n dirugnu 瓶子
#n dirugnu 瓶子
#e There was a transparent bottle.
#c 有個很透明的玻璃小瓶子。
#n kalas 玻璃
#e They two were watching that.
#c 他們兩個在欣賞它。
#e And then his dog liked that.
#c 然後他的小狗很喜歡它。
#e He shook and watched (the frog).
#c 他搖一搖而且望著(青蛙)。
#e And then when the child was tired, he went to bed.
#c 當那個小孩累的時候，就睡覺了。
#e When the child was sleeping, the frog jumped out.
#c 當那個小孩在睡覺的時候，這隻青蛙就跳出來了。
#n ituku跳
#e That frog is very good (at something).
#c 青蛙很厲害
#e No matter how small the bottle is, the frog jumped up and down, and finally ran away from the uncovered bottle mouth.
#c 不管瓶子有多小，青蛙跳得很厲害，跳來跳去，然後就從沒有蓋起來的小洞跳跑了。
#e The child got up.
#c 小孩就起來了。
#e And (the child) was surprised and said, “Why was there no frog?”
#c (小孩)很驚訝地說：「青蛙怎麼會不見了？」

gloss: 名物化-重疊-睡-名物化-3SG.屬格
free: #e And then (he) kept looking at the bottle from his bed in this way.
#c 然後就像這樣，小孩一直從床鋪上看著瓶子
#e That girl asked where the frog has gone.
#c 那個女生說青蛙去哪裡呢？
#e I don’t know whether (the child) is male or female
#c 我不知道(小孩)是男生還是女生呢
#n 這是發音老師自己的自問
#e When he came down from the bed, he thought that (the frog) might be inside the shoes.
#c 當他從床鋪下來，想說(青蛙)可能在鞋子裡
#e And he held the long, thick rubbers and looked down into them. And then he went inside the hole.
#c 他拿起又高又厚的雨鞋往裡面看下去，然後就進了那個洞。
#n lapa(pu)bebe-belenge往上看
#e But there was nothing.
#c 可是沒有啊。
#e And then his dog went into that bottle immoderately.
#c 然後他的狗變本加厲地進去了那個瓶子。
#n 再請老師舉一些 pasidruadrua的用法。
#e (The dog) entered the bottle, smelled it and went into the big bottle.
#c (那隻狗)進到那個大瓶子裡，聞了聞。

gloss: 名物化-方式-重疊-呈現¬-名物化

free: #e The bottle’s shape was like the glass (bottle).
#c 那個瓶子的樣子像是玻璃瓶。
#e How about the dog?
#c 那狗呢?
#e When (he) did this, how could it be the dog?
#c 當他這麼做的時候，怎麼會是這隻狗呢？
#e (He) took it up and ate.
#c (他)拿起來吃。
#e (He) said this surprisingly and then held the dog angrily.
#c 然後很驚訝地說著，然後就生氣地抱著那隻狗。
#e “Is it you that take it?” And then (he) said.
#c 然後他說：「是你拿的嗎？」
#e “Is it you that eat?” He scolded and asked.
#c 他用責備的語氣問說：「是不是你吃的？」
#e Is it that dog, or the child?
#c 是那隻狗嗎？還是小孩？
#e The dog kept barking, “Where did he go?”
#c 那狗一直叫：「他去哪裡呢？」
#e (He) said, “Where did the frog go?”
#c (他)說：「青蛙去哪了？」
#e When he said so, then the dog followed and barked.
#c 當他說這樣時，然後狗就跟著叫。
#e When (the dog) was barking in this way, indicating that there was one hornet in a tree.
#c 當(狗)這樣叫時，說著樹上有一隻虎頭蜂。
#e From his voice, two kinds of voice, the hornet came out and flied.
#c 從聲音出來，有兩種聲音，虎頭蜂飛出來了
#e The dog which was under the hornets was shocked (by the sound of the hornets.)
#c 在虎頭蜂下面的狗，因為受到(虎頭蜂)聲音的驚嚇，往上吠。
#e That child looked at the hornets along the hole.
#c 那小孩沿著洞往虎頭蜂所在處瞧。
#e The child was surprised.
#c 這個小孩很驚訝。
#e The dog was barking and light rubbing (against the tree).
#c 那隻狗一直吠並且(靠著樹)磨蹭。
#n ma-la-bungubungu nakuane 不要煩我
#e What’s hanged in the tree?
#c 什麼吊在樹上?
#e The dog went to the trunk where the hornets live and scratched the trunk.
#c 這隻狗到這顆虎頭蜂居住的樹旁抓刨著樹幹。
#n presidential building=tangadrane
#e The dog kept scratching the trunk causing the tree to strongly waver; the branch is then broken and the hive falls down.
#c 這隻狗抓刨著樹幹時，樹不斷的搖晃，樹枝因而折斷，虎頭蜂的巢就掉下來了。
#n ma-samali  be surprised
#n ma-samali  be surprised
#e Then these hornets kept humming; the voles were surprised and frightened. That’s how it is.
#c 這些虎頭蜂嗡嗡叫，田鼠驚嚇又害怕，就是這樣。
#e The child went up the tree. There was a hole on the tree.
#c 這個小孩子就到樹上，樹上有個(很大)的洞。
#n lulutu 像是一般的地上的洞 但田鼠、蛇類挖的洞叫做barurungulu
#e And then the child peeped at the hole: “What is inside the hole?”
#c 小朋友在偷看那個洞：「這是什麼洞？」
#e Why is this a hole?
#c 這個怎麼是洞穴呢？
#e The child was surprised why there were so many holes on the tree?
#c 小孩很驚訝怎麼有那麼多洞穴。
#e The child was surprised at those holes.
#c 小孩很驚訝那些洞穴。
#e The owl came out from it.
#c 貓頭鷹從禮拜跑出來
#n alaiyai 像是DM的「說」
#e The owl slept in the holes of trees.
#c 貓頭鷹都睡在樹上的洞穴裡。
#e The dog was chasing the bees. And the child was so frightened that he fell down from the tree.
#c 狗在追蜜蜂，小孩嚇到了就掉了下來。
#e The child fell down because he was afraid of this.
#c 小孩掉下來因為他怕這個。
#e Bees were chasing dogs.
#c 蜜蜂追狗。
#e What about the child then?
#c 那時候小孩子呢？
#e He was afraid of the owl.
#c 他就怕貓頭鷹。
#e The hornet wanted to sting us. We left and walked above the big rock.
#c 虎頭蜂想要叮我們。我們走到大岩石上面。
#e His dog kept barking.
#c 他的狗一直叫。
#e The child called the dog back. But their voice was different. The owl on the tree saw them calling each other.
#c 小孩叫小狗，叫聲有些不同，貓頭鷹在樹上看他們叫來叫去。
#n kia vava 遊戲
#e The child on the rock thought of the horn of the goat as the tree and touched it.
#c 在岩石上的小孩以為山羊的角是樹，摸著它。
#e Their dog kept barking.
#c 他的狗一直叫。
#e When the child touched it, he didn’t know it was the goat’s horn.
#c 當小孩摸角的時候，他不知道那是山羊的角。
#e Then the goat moved and held up the child.
#c 然後山羊就動了，還把小孩舉起來。
#e The child was hanged on the horn of the goat.
#c 小孩被鉤在山羊的角上。
#e The goat was jumping and running and then left. It also took away the child.
#c 山羊邊跑邊跳地離開，還帶走小孩。
#e The child was hooked by the horn. The goat ran away and the child followed (the goat) and left.
#c 小孩被角套住，山羊跑走了，小孩也就跟著離開。
#e The dog asked the goat: “He is my master. Why do you take it away?”
#c 小狗問山羊：「他是我的主人，為什麼你要把他帶走？」
#n mua-bere 跑掉
#n mua-bere 跑掉

gloss: 懸崖名物化-來-名物化-3PL.屬格
free: #e When they ran away, they arrived at the cliff.
#c 當他們跑走，他們到了懸崖。
#e Then the goat came to the cliff; it was so frightened that it stopped. Then the child was sprung from the goat.
#c 山羊到了懸崖，就停了下來。小孩就彈了出去。
#e The dog fell down into water.
#c 小狗掉到水裡面。
#e Why (do we) say water is below while the goat is above?
#c 為什麼說水是在下面，山羊在上面呢？
#e It stopped and the dog fell down. The child fell down as well.
#c 他就停下來，狗掉下來，小孩也掉下來。
#e The goat looked below and said sorry to them.
#c 山羊往下面看跟他們說：「對不起！對不起！」
#n buru 形容小孩跳到水裡的聲音
#e The child jumped into the water and carried the dog on his shoulder.
#c 小孩跳進水裡，把狗扛在肩上到了水邊。
#e The child left for the riverside. There was a hole. So they went up the tree.
#c 小孩要離開去水邊，有一個洞穴，(他們)就去在樹上。
#e Keep quiet.
#c 安靜。
#e Why did (I) say so?
#c 為什麼要這樣說呢？
#e The child saw the frog in the back.
#c 小孩在後面有看到青蛙。
#e (The child) was going to pick up the frog. Please Be quiet.
#c (小孩)要拿青蛙，請大家安靜啦！
#e When the dog was quiet, there were two frogs in the back of the hole of the tree.
#c 當小狗安靜下來時，有兩隻青蛙在木頭的洞的後面。
#e The child picked up the frog immediately.
#c 小孩就馬上把青蛙拿起來。
#e When there were two frogs, the child took away the only one.
#c 有兩隻青蛙時，小孩只拿走一隻。
#e The frog was taken away and its companions were surprised.
#c 青蛙被帶走，那些同伴很驚訝。
#e And then (the frog) said goodbye and left.
#c 然後(青蛙)說再見就離開了。
#e The dog and the child took the frog away.
#c 小狗跟小孩把青蛙帶走。
#n sia-va-vava  watch
#n sia-va-vava  watch
#e Other frogs were watching their companions being taken away.
#c 其他的(青蛙)都在看他們被帶走的同伴。
#e So the story is like this.
#c 所以這個故事就是這樣
#n bulru 教導  a-bu-bulru 傳說
